summary: This code uses Emacsclient to execute a Lisp script named "lsp.sh". It sets the buffer to "lsp.sh", prints 'hello, and then prints 'world. No mention of writing a macro is present in this code.

details.comment: This code uses Emacsclient to execute a Lisp script named "lsp.sh". It sets the buffer to "lsp.sh", prints 'hello, and then prints 'world. No mention of writing a macro is present in this code.
details.content:
emacsclient -s foo -e "(progn (set-buffer \"lsp.sh\") (print 'hello) (print 'world))"
# shall you write macro?
